reviews.subject: Introduction to Psychology
reviews.review: Dr. Johnson is an excellent professor who makes complex concepts easy to understand. Her lectures are engaging and she is very approachable for help.

reviews.subject: Calculus I
reviews.review: Professor Smith is knowledgeable and provides clear explanations. However, his assignments can be quite challenging and there is little feedback on grading.

reviews.subject: Organic Chemistry
reviews.review: Dr. Nguyen's class is informative but can be a bit disorganized. She tends to rush through material and the exams are very difficult.

reviews.subject: Modern Literature
reviews.review: Dr. Lee is passionate about literature and his discussions are always stimulating. The coursework is intensive but rewarding.

reviews.subject: Introduction to Computer Science
reviews.review: Professor Clark is fantastic! She makes programming accessible and fun. Her labs are very practical and useful for understanding the concepts.

reviews.subject: Advanced Calculus
reviews.review: Dr. Martinez is a knowledgeable professor but struggles with communication. Her lectures are often difficult to follow and her grading is harsh.

reviews.subject: Microeconomics
reviews.review: Professor White is great at explaining economic theories and their real-world applications. The class is challenging but very rewarding.

reviews.subject: Biochemistry
reviews.review: Dr. Zhou is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about biochemistry. Her lectures are well-structured and she provides excellent support to students.

reviews.subject: Creative Writing
reviews.review: Professor Turner encourages creativity and provides insightful feedback. The course is engaging and offers plenty of opportunities for personal expression.

reviews.subject: Physics I
reviews.review: Dr. Adams is a good teacher but the pace of the course can be too fast. The lectures are often rushed, which makes it hard to grasp some concepts.

reviews.subject: Sociology
reviews.review: Professor Harris is excellent at facilitating discussions and making sociology relevant to current events. His passion for the subject is evident and inspiring.

reviews.subject: Introduction to Statistics
reviews.review: Dr. Kim explains statistical concepts clearly and provides plenty of practical examples. The course is well-organized and her teaching style is engaging.

reviews.subject: International Relations
reviews.review: Professor Lewis is knowledgeable but his lectures can be quite dry. He tends to focus on theory rather than practical applications, which can be a bit dull.
